Activation won't work for me... Does it always say "Repair" instead of activate? What's my mistake?! I uninstalled everything before...
-------
Die Aktivierung funktioniert irgendwie nicht. Sagt er immer "Reparieren" statt Aktvieren. Wo liegt mein Fehler? Ich hab vorher alles deinstalliert.

Wer vorher schon eine CS3-Installation drauf hatte, könnte - genau wie ich - Probleme haben. Daher folgende Erklärung, gleich auf Englisch für die "anderen".

Delete ENTIRE registration of Adobe products.

After doing the standard uninstall procedure, get the cleanup script from the Adobe website ( http://www.adobe.com/support/contact/cs3clean.html )
Run it and if you are asked for the level of clean-up, choose "4", although not mentioned as a possibility. Attention: this will delete every Adobe-Product and every registration of those you have on your entire computer (including some Macromedia apps)
Then, in the terminal, type in "su", then your root-password and run the cleanup script again (you can copy the command from the one created by the cleanup script). E.g.: python /Volumes/maccs3clean/MacCS3Clean/CS3Clean.py
Run it until the log doesn't show any more files that were deleted. (at least 2 times)
Then go to your user folder and in ~/Library/Application Support and check if the "Adobe" folder is gone. If not delete it.
Then open the root directory of your hard drive and open the Library there and then Application Support (/Library/Application Support). Also check for the Adobe folder, delete it if necessary. Then, delete the folder "FLEXnet Publisher". Then go to /Library/Preferences and delete the folder "FLEXnet Publisher" (yeah, same name), too.
This should be everything. I've heard of cases, where something was stored in /var/tmp, too, so if you still can't reinstall your CS3 without being asked to "repair" the installation, have a look there (the files may begin with "lm")

Good luck! :-)

P.S.: Sorry for the english, hope you understand the important things!
P.P.S.: Feedback please, if someone tried!

Nice! Thanx a lot..it is woring finally, even if the clean up script was not a big help. it showed me only the files which supposed to be delete, but there were still ALL in their folders.
Whatever, I did it manually. The clean up script was good to show me all the folders where Adobe was. I installed CS3 again (english version), I typed the serial number i got (;-)) and it is working!!!  THX!!
